H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H2950.def: = to cover a surface with {L:whitewash<SDBH:תָּפֵל>} ► to make it white and cover ugly rough surfaces; ≈ often associated with efforts to make something appear different from what it actually is

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H457.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7423.def: = state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H1354.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = a human-made object with a somewhat convex shape

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

22.gl: to take (one's) life in (one's) hand > to risk (one's) life

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H262.def: = information conveyed to other people through speech

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6206.def: = process by which humans experience an extreme fear

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5086.def: = process by which the wind causes objects to be moved from one place to the other

H5929.def: = one of the expanded, usually green structures growing from the stem of a plant; ► providing shade; ≈ associated with life when green, but known to wither when disconnected from the plant and therefore also denoting the fragility of life

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H3002.def: = state in which objects are free from moisture

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H4846.def: literally: bitter (organ); hence: = gall bladder, ≈ known for its bitter contents

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5465.def: = a wooden structure with holes for securing a person’s feet and hands, in which criminals are locked

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H2707.def: = causative action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object, ◄ by carving, drawing, etc., ► for the purpose of decoration and/or communication

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H7538.def: = a natural process by which certain objects slowly degenerate until they disappear

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6211.def: = smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object
